item.title: Report E-2024090535
item.description:
Report E-2024090535

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Kem-Tek Pool & Spa Care Swimming Pool Muriatic Acid. A Contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release of product onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 12’x4’ area on both surfaces. It appears as though the release is a result of dunnage. The contractor neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate. The damaged/impacted bottles of product were containerized into one 30-gallon DF for waste disposal. The impacted and neutralized pallet pieces, oil dry, PPE, cardboard, and absorbent pads were containerized into two 30-gallon DF’s for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated from the emergency response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report I-2024090055
item.description:
Report I-2024090055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: Pittsburg
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was loading trailer with Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5%(16140525) at K2 when it overflowed the top of the trailer. Scales were closed due an unrelated incident so the load quantity calculation had to be completed manually. Driver did not use an inch stick to confirm initial quantity before loading, resulting in an overflow. Driver stated less than 10 gallons went into the containment area. No exposure and no off-site release. Release was contained and cleaned up to operator's satisfaction.

item.title: Report E-2024090543
item.description:
Report E-2024090543

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:03 on 8/31, XPO-UKC contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 5 ounces of "Benco M5 Semi-Gloss Lacquer" from a 5-gallon poly pail impacting the trailer floor. The pail was improperly loaded by UBY. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. Terminal used oil dri to contain the spill and waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090540
item.description:
Report E-2024090540

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:20 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (USD) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to the product being crushed by other freight, approximately 2 gallons of MRC Metering Roller Cleaner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. XPO stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product and damaged pail were placed into a 10-gallon metal drum and staged for personnel to handle.

item.title: Report I-2024090037
item.description:
Report I-2024090037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: Garden Grove
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At ATL, on 08/19/2024, the SAFRAN Garden Grove Repair Station received, from Delta Airlines a P/N D29982-225 Pass Slide EVAC RO# 4701481897 by truck which is a Dangerous Good commodity(UN2990). The freight wasn't identified as a dangerous good with the correct markings for a DG shipment. The receiving team opened the freight only to discover that a DG item was inside of the wooden cart. This package was not shipped by air transportation. The truck loading lanes containing DG and non-DG were next to each other leading to the mix up of shipments. This event remains under investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024090518
item.description:
Report E-2024090518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-26T09:22:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Patriot Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft- by-3ft area of the trailer floor and concrete lot and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. Patriot Environmental Services personnel used absorbent pads to recover the released material. Two (2) pails of , and the product could not be removed therefore these two (2) pails along with the one (1) damaged pail were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite. The waste will remain onsite until the waste profile has been completed and approved for transport for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024091295
item.description:
Report X-2024091295

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-02
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 1st a package was found during the PM sort a package was found leaking. The package was opened and four cans of IPE Oil Deck Stain were found, with two of those cans leaking from the lids being opened. An SDS confirmed that this shipment is UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII. There were no markings or indications on the outside of the package indicating that it contained and dangerous goods. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024091327
item.description:
Report X-2024091327

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: Bloomington
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank car CGTX 31178 was found in the West Colton Yard in Bloomington, CA with diesel down the sides of the tank car and between the manway and the combination housing. After assessment it was determined that the manway swing bolts were over tightened causing the manway to be misaligned, also, the safety eye bolt was offset/bowed from being over torqued causing product to release. The manway gasket was inspected, and no issues where found. The tank car manway was reset, and the swing bolts were secured properly. Contractor cleaned off all diesel impacted areas on the tank car.

item.title: Report E-2024090447
item.description:
Report E-2024090447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 16, 2024, at 1055 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Los Angeles, California regarding the release of Methylene Chloride. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 30 gallons of Methylene Chloride (Dichloromethane, UN1593, 6.1, IIII) from (1) 55-gallon DM. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a pallet and an area of the trailer floor. Contractors placed the damaged drum in an overpack and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 85-gallon plastic overpack, then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
